creator: sanjay_koti@keane-nne.com
text:
Hi,

We encounter these (below pasted) error messages in /opt/jakarta-tomcat-
4.0.3/logs/ catalina_log.2003-02-20.txt everyday ; resulting in performance 
degradation and dropped user sessions.

2003-02-20 10:15:48 HttpConnector[8080] accept:
java.net.SocketException: No buffer space available
        at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.socketAccept(Native Method)
        at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.accept(Unknown Source)
        at java.net.ServerSocket.implAccept(Unknown Source)
        at java.net.ServerSocket.accept(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.catalina.connector.http.HttpConnector.run
(HttpConnector.java:993)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)

2003-02-20 10:15:48 HttpConnector[8080] Opening server socket on all host IP 
addresses

creator: remm@apache.org
text:
I still didn't see any other report with such exception, so I cannot comment too
much. If the socket accept fails with an exception, that usually means major
networking trouble for the JVM (and likely a bug in there). Likely upgrading to
a newer Tomcat release won't help; I think you'll have to find a better VM.
